intro: Meniscium ensiforme, commonly known as the narrowleaf meniscium, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered white or greenish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, and it is often found in temperate climates. Meniscium ensiforme is known for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
